subject: Nutrition
title: Caffeine as Performance Fuel
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Caffeine as Performance Fuel.

hook.text: Caffeine improves endurance by 3 to 5%. That margin wins Olympic medals and breaks records.

buildup.text: Caffeine blocks adenosine receptors, reducing perceived effort and delaying the onset of fatigue.

discovery.text: The optimal dose is 3 to 6 mg per kilogram, taken 30 to 60 minutes before exercise begins.

twist.text: Caffeine was banned by the Olympics until 2004. Today virtually every endurance athlete uses it.

climax.text: Higher doses don't improve performance‚Äîthey cause anxiety and stomach distress that hurt results.

punchline.text: A cup of coffee is a legal performance-enhancing drug.

quiz.question: By how much does caffeine improve endurance performance?
